sentences: Juhtisin meie gruppi. (I led our group.)
Ta juhiti hästi. (He/She was led well.)
Juhin teid nüüd. (I will lead you now.)
context: 'Juhin' is the first person singular indicative form of the Estonian verb 'juhtima', meaning 'to lead'. It specifically means 'I lead' in present tense. The word comes from the same root as English words like 'lead' and 'leader', indicating guidance or direction.
